intro: Palmerocassia unijuga, commonly known as the single-seeded burr, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its unique seed structure, which resembles a burr, aids in seed dispersal by attaching to animal fur or human clothing. The species is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and degraded habitats.
